metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the ind-def:filehash_test is properly supported
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the ind-def:filehash_test.

notes.note: It is important to note that the values used in this test definition are specific to a particular machine, and may not necessarily apply to your system. As a result, in order to have the definition return a result of 'true', you must either change these values to the ones found on your particular system, or you must configure your system to use these values.

criterion.comment: Test that the filehash_object is supported with the path entity equal to some value and the filename entity equal to some value.
Test that the filehash_object is supported with the path entity matching some regular expression and the filename equal to some value.
Test that the filehash_object is supported with the path entity equal to some value and the filename matching some regular expression.
Test that the filehash_object is supported with the path entity equal to some value and the filename entity not equal to some value.
Test that the max_depth behavior is supported for a limited depth of recursion.
Test that the max_depth behavior is supported for an unlimited depth of recursion.
Test that the recurse_direction behavior is supported.

filehash_test.comment: Test that the filehash_object is supported with the path entity equal to some value and the filename entity equal to some value.
Test that the filehash_object is supported with the path entity matching some regular expression and the filename equal to some value.
Test that the filehash_object is supported with the path entity equal to some value and the filename matching some regular expression.
Test that the filehash_object is supported with the path entity equal to some value and the filename entity not equal to some value.
Test that the max_depth behavior is supported for a limited depth of recursion.
Test that the max_depth behavior is supported for an unlimited depth of recursion.
Test that the recurse_direction behavior is supported.

filehash_object.comment: This object represents a filehash_item with a path equal to '/usr/bin' and a filename equal to 'ls'.
This object represents a filehash_item with a path that matches the regular expression '^/usr/b.n$' and a filename equal to 'ls'.
This object represents a filehash_item with a path equal to '/usr/bin' and a filename that matches the regular expression '^l'.
This object represents a filehash_item with path equal to '/usr/bin', and a filename that is not equal to 'ls'.
This object represents a filehash_item with path starting at '/usr', recursing down 1 level, and filename equals 'ls'.
This object represents a filehash_item with path starting at '/etc', recursing down infinitely, and filename equals 'README'.
This object represents a filehash_item with path starting at '/etc/init.d', recursing up 1 level, and filename equals 'profile'.

filehash_state.comment: This filehash_state represents a filehash_item which has a path equal to '/usr/bin' (with optional trailing slash to cope with ovaldi's sloppiness with regard to trailing slashes), a filename equal to 'ls', a md5 hash that matches the regular expression '.*', and a sha1 hash that matches the regular expression '.*'.

This filehash_state represents a filehash_item which has a path that matches the regular expression '^/usr/b.n$', a filename that equals 'ls', a md5 hash that matches the regular expression '.*', and a sha1 hash that matches the regular expression '.*'.

This filehash_state represents a filehash_item which has a path equal to '/usr/bin', a filename that matches the regular expression '^l', a md5 hash that matches the regular expression '.*', and a sha1 hash that matches the regular expression '.*'.

This filehash_state represents a filehash_item which has a path of '/usr/bin', a filename that is not equal to 'ls', a md5 hash that matches the regular expression '.*', and a sha1 hash that matches the regular expression '.*'.

This filehash_state represents a filehash_item which has a path that equals '/etc/init.d', a filename that equals 'README', a md5 hash that matches the regular expression '.*', and a sha1 hash that matches the regular expression '.*'.

This filehash_state represents a filehash_item which has a path that contains '/etc', a filename that equals 'profile', a md5 hash that matches the regular expression '.*', and a sha1 hash that matches the regular expression '.*'.
